snippet: Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher considered calling out the British military to transport vital supplies during the strike, which became a defining confrontation of the Thatcher era, according to newly released documents.
abstract: Newly-released documents reveal that in 1984, Prime Min Margaret Thatcher secretly considered calling out the British military to transport vital supplies around the country and declaring a state of emergency to bolster the government during miner's strike; confrontation was a defining event of the Thatcher era.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher considered calling out the British military to transport vital supplies during the strike, which became a defining confrontation of the Thatcher era, according to newly released documents.

headline.main: Thatcher Debated Using Military in 1984 Miners’ Strike
headline.print_headline: Thatcher Debated Using Military in 1984 Miners’ Strike
